title: Spatiotemporal Failure Prediction for Smart Grids
technologies: PyTorch, JAX, CUDA, Graph Neural Networks, Transformers, Signal Processing
description: Designed topology-aware graph transformers for predicting power grid failures. Built multi-scale temporal feature pipeline capturing short and long-term patterns. Implemented CUDA optimizations reducing training time by 80%.
problem: Power grid operators need early warning systems to prevent cascading failures and optimize maintenance schedules. Traditional methods struggle with sparse sensor data and complex spatial dependencies.
approach: Designed topology-aware graph transformers that inject network structure into attention mechanisms for spatial failure propagation
Built multi-scale temporal feature pipeline (30s, 60s, 180s windows) capturing short and long-term patterns
Applied physics-informed constraints and focal loss to handle extreme class imbalance in failure events
Implemented CUDA optimizations reducing training time by 80% for real-time model updates
impact: Enables predictive maintenance workflows and critical asset ranking for grid operators. Demonstrated on Oklahoma G&E PMU data (2009-2022) covering real-world failure scenarios.

title: Measurement-Free River Depth Recovery Using UAV Data
technologies: JAX, TensorFlow, HEC-RAS, QGIS, Tecplot, PINNs, Bayesian Inference
description: Developed physics-informed neural networks solving Shiono-Knight Method PDEs to invert river depth profiles from UAV surface velocity data. Accelerated PINN training by 70% through GPU optimization.
problem: Traditional river bathymetry surveys are costly, time-consuming, and dangerous in flood conditions. A non-invasive approach using surface velocity measurements could revolutionize flood modeling and channel design.
approach: Developed physics-informed neural networks solving Shiono-Knight Method PDEs to invert river depth profiles from UAV surface velocity data
Integrated remote sensing data with PDE-constrained neural networks for measurement-free bathymetry estimation
Applied Bayesian uncertainty quantification and Polynomial Chaos Expansion for confidence intervals
Accelerated PINN training by 70% through GPU optimization in JAX
impact: Demonstrates feasibility of non-contact river characterization for R&D applications in flood risk assessment and hydraulic engineering. Currently in preparation for Water Resources Research (AGU).
